issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
The message: "[WARN] 'KitchenSink.Media.Sound.audioSessionMode' is deprecated; use 'KitchenSink.Media.audioSessionMode'" is shown by the console.

This is not regression it occurs on SDK 2.1.0.GA

Steps to reproduce: 
1) Launch refactored Kitchen Sink (Kevin Winnerey/Developer relations version) > Phone > Sound
2)  Tap on 'Background Audio'>'Start'.


Result:
The message appears in the console:
"[WARN] 'KitchenSink.Media.Sound.audioSessionMode' is deprecated; use 'KitchenSink.Media.audioSessionMode'"

Expected Result:
Deprecation warnings should refer to actual Titanium APIs
fields.summary: iOS: Phone > Sound > Background Audio: 'KitchenSink.Media.Sound.audioSessionMode' message in console
fields.environment:
iPhone 4S Sprint (5.1)
iPad2 (4.3.5) , iPad3 4G (5.1.1)
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.1.201207171343
SDK version: 2.1.1.v20120723131610

setting to resolved fixed as this bug was reopened on commenting due to a JIRA bug. Will test with 2.2.0 and close if appropriate.
